CatDescriptText: Miss Bertha Cornelius,123 W, 12th St., Homestead, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 10, 1958, pg. A2, with question: "Do you think that Negroes display any racial prejudice towards each other?"  Answer reads: "I don't think so, at least not here in Pittsburgh."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bertha Cornelius wearing cape style coat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, with Pittsburgh Courier reporter George Barbour in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
